intro: Anemone decapetala, commonly known as the decapetal anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features showy, white to pale pink flowers with ten petals, which give it its scientific name. The plant has a basal rosette of serrated, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Anemone decapetala is often found in woodland habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
